qas.question: Who has research stations in Antarctica?
What is the span of population density per million square kilometers of researchers in Antarctica?
About long long do researchers stay when researching in Antarctica?
What station has an Orthodox church representative?
When did the Trinity Church begin its posting at Bellinshausen station?
Who maintains perminent settlements on the continent?

plausible_answers.text: on the continent and its nearby islands

qas.question: Where are there 5,000 year round residents?
How many people are conducting research on nearby islands in the winter?
How many people are conducting research on nearby islands in the summer?

plausible_answers.text: between 70 and 350 inhabitants per million square kilometres

qas.question: What is the population density of the surrounding islands?
What year did Trinity Orthodox open?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Several governments<b5_0/><a0_0/> maintain permanent manned research stations on the continent. The number of people conducting and supporting scientific research and other work <b7_0>on the continent and its nearby islands<b7_0/> varies from about <b8_0>1,000<b8_0/> in winter to about <b9_0>5,000<b9_0/> in the summer, giving it a population density <a1_0><b10_0>between 70 and 350<a1_0/> inhabitants per million square kilometres<b10_0/> (180 and 900 per million square miles) at these times. Many of the stations are staffed year-round, the winter-over personnel typically arriving from their home countries for a <a2_0>one-year<a2_0/> assignment. An Orthodox church—<b6_0>Trinity Church<b6_0/>, opened in <a4_0><b11_0>2004<b11_0/><a4_0/> at the <b12_0>Russian <a3_0>Bellingshausen Station<b12_0/><a3_0/>—is manned year-round by one or two priests, who are similarly rotated every year.
